content.description: <math alttext="2 H 2 O 2, liquid, reacts to produce 2 H 2 O, liquid, plus O 2 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>
content.question: Bond Average Bond Enthalpy <math alttext="in kilojoules per mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(kJ/mol)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="O H single bond" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>O</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 463 <math alttext="O O single bond" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>O</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 146 <math alttext="O O double bond" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>O=O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 495 Shown above are the equation representing the decomposition of <math alttext="H 2 O 2, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and a table of bond enthalpies. On the basis of the information, which of the following is the enthalpy of decomposition of <math alttext="2 moles" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>2 mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="H 2 O 2, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
